response:
reasoning='We need to provide a Spectre-compatible 5‐transistor OTA plus its biasing circuit in a single subcircuit, using only the tsmc18dP and tsmc18dN models, and follow exactly the required formatting.  

Topology choice: a classic single‐ended 5‐transistor OTA with an NMOS differential pair (M1, M2), PMOS active‐load current mirror (M3, M4), and an NMOS tail transistor (M5).  The bias current IB is injected at the port ibp10u and is mirrored by a diode‐connected NMOS (M0), whose gate drives M5.  Thus IB sets the OTA tail bias without extra external elements.  

Device sizing (first‐order, typical 1.8 μm process scaling):  
• M0 (bias diode): W=5 μm, L=0.18 μm  
• M5 (tail):        W=10 μm, L=0.18 μm  
• M1, M2 (inputs):  W=20 μm, L=0.18 μm  
• M3, M4 (loads):   W=40 μm, L=0.18 μm  

Nodes:  
• The diode M0 is connected between ibp10u and VSS.  
• Its gate at ibp10u biases M5, whose drain (net1) feeds the sources of M1/M2.  
• M1/M2 drains go to the PMOS current‐mirror load M3 (diode) and M4 (output), forming a single‐ended output at vout.  
• vin and vip are the negative and positive differential inputs, respectively.  
• Bulk for NMOS is VSS, for PMOS is VDD.  

This netlist meets all specified port usage and formatting requirements: header comments, exact subckt line, transistor instantiations with no placeholders, ends line, footer comments, I16 instantiation, and no extra text or blank lines.' config=ConfigFile(netlist='// Library name: MP3
// Cell name: ota
// View name: schematic
subckt ota VDD VSS ibp10u vin vip vout
    M0 (ibp10u ibp10u VSS VSS) tsmc18dN w=5u l=0.18u
    M5 (net1 ibp10u VSS VSS)    tsmc18dN w=10u l=0.18u
    M1 (vout vin net1 VSS)     tsmc18dN w=20u l=0.18u
    M2 (net3 vip net1 VSS)     tsmc18dN w=20u l=0.18u
    M3 (net3 net3 VDD VDD)     tsmc18dP w=40u l=0.18u
    M4 (vout net3 VDD VDD)     tsmc18dP w=40u l=0.18u
ends ota
// Library name: MP3
// Cell name: dut
// View name: schematic
I16 (net1 net2 net6 net4 net3 net5) ota')
